alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Cherry; Grant; Hooker; McPherson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 23 at 12:15AM CDT until April 23 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Arthur County in west central Nebraska... Southwestern Cherry County in north central Nebraska... Eastern Grant County in west central Nebraska... Western Hooker County in west central Nebraska... Western McPherson County in west central Nebraska... * Until 115 AM CDT/1215 AM MDT/. * At 1214 AM CDT/1114 PM MDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of Medicine Lake to 7 miles south of Arthur, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Arthur, Hyannis, Whitman, Medicine Lake, Duluth, Flatts, Cogill Lake, Green Lake, Bucktail Lake, Indian Hill, Three Mile Lake, Pratt Lake, Sevenmile Hill, Carr Lake, Highway 61 crossing the Snake River, Haythorn Lake and Lena. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 145 and 178. Highway 61 between mile markers 112 and 213. Highway 92 between mile markers 165 and 191. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
